projecttitle: MALAWI CLEARING A/C HQ - Agriculture & Food Production - Pillar 1 Research - 1072-Agricultural research - -AGR-Agriculture
project_descrip: Short: MALAWI CLEARING A/C HQ - AGRICULTURE & FOOD PRODUCTION - PILLAR 1 RESEARCH - 1072-AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH - -AGR-AGRICULTURE Long: The Government's Farm Inputs Subsidy Programme, which aims to increase productivity among smallholders and strengthen household food security, is largely credited with the dramatic improvement in the food security situation in Malawi since the food crisis in 2002. Irish Aid's support to this programme focuses on promoting crop diversification, particularly legumes, improving the availability of certified seeds through building a strong national seed industry and strengthening oversight and monitoring. In 2012, in addition to supporting this programme, we will also jointly finance a medium-term plan to guide its implementation. Our partnership with the International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics (ICRISAT) is focused on improving access and availability of improved varieties of seed, particularly legumes. Support is provided to the African Institute of Corporate Citizenship (AICC) to develop the legume value chains particularly ground nuts and pigeon peas. Ireland will also provide financial support to Concern Universal for a Local Development Support Programme which places particular emphasis on small scale irrigation and sustainable livelihoods in four rural Districts. Support to the International Potato Centre (CIP) aims to increase the numbers of smallholder farmers who can grow more productive varieties of potato, to introduce varieties of Vitamin A-enriched sweet potato into selected Districts and to increase farmer incomes. For the past five years Irish Aid has supported the World Agro-Forestry Centre (ICRAF) in working with smallholders to improve soil fertility and increase crop yields through the use of fertiliser and fruit trees and the promotion of sustainable land management practices. This support was fully evaluated in 2011 and a follow-on programme will be put in place in 2012. To complement agro-forestry work support will be provided to develop macadamia nuts production through Equal Exchange, an NGO which specialises in developing smallholder market access. Support will continue to the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI) to build the links between agriculture, nutrition and health in Malawi and to support the implementation of the Comprehensive Africa Agriculture Development Programme (CAADP) and the Agriculture Sector Wide Approach programme (ASWAp). Irish Aid also supports the promotion of a national conservation agriculture focused on improving smallholder farmer productivity and adaptation to climate change with the National Smallholder Association of Malawi (NASFAM).
